concise_definition: n. 赌注, 打赌; v. 打赌, 押注

definitions.explanation_en: A sum of money or other valuable item staked on the outcome of a contest, game, or uncertain event, typically based on chance or prediction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在一场竞赛、游戏或不确定事件的结果上所押注的金钱或其他贵重物品，通常基于运气或预测。
definitions.example_en: He placed a $500 wager on the underdog team to win the championship.
definitions.example_cn: 他押了500美元赌冷门球队赢得冠军。

definitions.explanation_en: A statement or opinion expressed with strong confidence, often implying a personal risk or commitment to its truth.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以极大信心表达的陈述或观点，常暗含个人对其真实性的承担或风险。
definitions.example_en: I’ll wager that the meeting will be postponed until next week.
definitions.example_cn: 我敢打赌会议会推迟到下周。

definitions.explanation_en: To risk money or something of value on the outcome of an uncertain event, especially in a game of chance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在不确定事件的结果上冒风险押注金钱或有价值之物，尤指在赌博游戏中。
definitions.example_en: They wagered their entire savings on the horse race.
definitions.example_cn: 他们把全部积蓄都押在了赛马上。

definitions.explanation_en: To assert something with confidence or certainty, often in a colloquial or emphatic way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以自信或强调的方式断言某事，常用于口语表达。
definitions.example_en: I wager you didn't expect this outcome.
definitions.example_cn: 我敢打赌你没料到这个结果。

comparison.analysis: “Bet” (赌注) 是 “wager” 最常见的同义词，两者在大多数语境中可互换。但 “bet” 更口语化、日常化，使用频率更高；而 “wager” 语体更正式，常用于书面语或法律、金融语境，有时带有更庄重或策略性的意味。
“Stake” (赌注/利害关系) 可作名词指押注的金额，也可指参与某事所承担的风险或利益。它更强调“所冒的风险”本身，而 “wager” 更强调“押注的行为”或“所押之物”。例如：He put his reputation on the stake（他拿声誉作赌注）——这里用 “stake” 更贴切，因强调的是潜在损失。
“Gamble” (赌博/冒险) 指进行高风险的投机行为，常带有道德或财务上的负面含义，强调不确定性与潜在损失。而 “wager” 仅指押注行为本身，不必然包含道德评判。例如：He gambled his fortune on the stock market（他拿财富在股市上赌博）——暗示鲁莽；而 “He wagered $100 on the game” 则中性。
